intro: Euphrasia italica, commonly known as the Italian eyebright, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers with prominent yellow spots. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branched. Euphrasia italica is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported eye health benefits.
